# Task

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.



# Special Instructions

{{instructions}}

Here is the Julia function that solves this problem. This function uses the Dates package to extract year and month from DateTime objects.

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map(x -> Dates.format(x, "yyyyMM"), df[:dt])
end
```
In this function `add_yearmonth`, we iterate over each row in the DataFrame and use the `Dates.format` function to convert the DateTime object into a string with format "yyyyMM". This string is then assigned as the value of the new column `:ym`. 

This solution assumes that your DataFrame has a DateTime column named 'dt'. If it doesn't, you need to replace `'dt'` with the correct name.

Please note that this function will overwrite any existing `ym` column in the DataFrame. If you want to keep the original data and create a new column, you should use a different column name or handle this separately before calling this function.
